issue.title: learnings are getting written to .md files

key_insights.problem_identified: Learnings were being stored as static .md files instead of in LightRAG vector database, making them non-searchable and isolated from pattern recognition
key_insights.solution_implemented: Created RIF-Learner agent, migrated all existing learning content to LightRAG collections, updated all agents to use vector storage
key_insights.business_impact: Enabled semantic search across all learning content, systematic knowledge growth, automatic pattern matching

patterns_identified.name: RIF-Learner Agent Implementation Pattern
patterns_identified.description: Pattern for creating specialized learning agents that extract knowledge from completed work and store in LightRAG

patterns_identified.name: Knowledge Migration Pattern
patterns_identified.description: 4-phase approach: Agent creation, content migration, agent behavior updates, workflow optimization

architectural_decisions.title: LightRAG Vector Database for Learning Storage
architectural_decisions.decision: Use LightRAG vector database with ChromaDB backend for all learning content storage
architectural_decisions.rationale: Enables semantic search, automatic pattern matching, knowledge relationship discovery, and systematic growth

future_improvements: Monitor code_snippets collection population as agents create reusable code
Track pattern recognition accuracy over time

risk_mitigation_applied.data_integrity: Content validation before and after migration
